Fields.DialogueText: Atlantis?
Atlantis?
Has anybody seen Atlantis?
Atlantis?
You! Officer Jin, excuse me. Have you seen Atlantis? I've been looking all over for her.
Last I saw her, she was leaving the mess hall, I think.
Thanks, I'll go check it out. If you see her, tell her to wait in my office, would you?
Yes, Captain - of course.
Where could she be?
Atlantis?
There she is! Finally!
Atlantis, I've been looking everywhere for you. We need to talk strategy for these upcoming battles.

Fields.MenuText: Atlantis, are you listening to me?
Just, stop, stand still for just two seconds, would you?
What are you up to? Inspecting the rail?

Fields.DialogueText: You can hear me, right? I mean, I know you can see me. Surely you're seeing me, flapping my gums. Can you just...
*ALARM*
Captain! We need you at the bridge, now!
All right, just a second, I need to...
Wait, where did she go?
Atlantis?
@BATTLE
Hey, wait one moment. Who's that guy over there?
You're going to have to be a little more specific, Captain.
The shady one.
The shady one?
The one leaning against the post.
Ah, him. You're right, he is awfully shady looking. Almost as shady as Seaman Brooks.
Almost. You know who he is? He isn't with the crew, is he?
Not exactly. I think he's with Atlantis.
With Atlantis?
Yes, I'm pretty sure.
Why would you think that?
He's been on the ship longer than either of us - longer than the majority of the crew, in fact. And nine times out of ten, if you see Atlantis, that guy isn't far behind.
You don't say?
That's as much information as I have.
You don't know his name?
I'm pretty sure it's something German.

Fields.MenuText: Well, that better than no information at all, I suppose.
How very specific, Raleigh.
I'm pretty sure I could have figured that out on my own.

Fields.DialogueText: Happy to help, Captain.
I'm afraid my duties preclude me from learning the name of every person aboard this ship, Captain.
Then I'll get back to my duties, Captain.
*ALARM*
Get to your station.
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
Hey, Atlantis! You did really well during that last battle. We couldn't have done it without you.
So, how do you think the battle went? You know, I'd be open to any feedback you were willing to give.
Okay, Atlantis, listen. I know you can hear me, and I know you're capable of speaking - you do both during our engagements with Morganas, after all.
But, I also know you Belles all have your own, individual ways of going about... well, life in general. So if you prefer not to speak outside of battle, that's fine.

Fields.MenuText: Could you nod your head, or give me some sign I'm on the right track?

Fields.DialogueText: Captain! Those Morganas seem to have found a second wind!
Wonderful. Atlantis, get to your station, would you? We'll continue this... conversation, later.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Could you at least look at me and not the rail?
If you're trying to make me uncomfortable, it's not working.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it's working a little bit...
Hey, Atlantis! You know, I was thinking that it might be nice if the cooks could prepare something you like to eat.
I mean you are the ship, after all. Day in and day out, you do a lot of very admirable work for us. It's only natural that we would want to show our gratitude.
So, are there any particular foods you're fond of? It could be anything. The more German the better, I say. The cooks have been itching for a challenge.

Fields.MenuText: Spätzle, maybe?
What do you think about a nice Abendbrot?
All Germans love Schnitzel, right? Right?

Fields.DialogueText: Atlantis, I'm really trying here. Honestly.
Could I get you a pen and paper? Do you use sign language? How about Morse code?
Smoke signals? I will learn to interpret smoke signals if that's what it takes. I will light a fire on deck right now.
Please, I just need something.
Atlantis? What is it? Say it, whatever you want.
*ALARM*
Of course.
@BATTLE
Captain, we are about to engage.
@BATTLE
Raleigh, tell the station chiefs I want their damage reports on my desk ASAP.
Yes, Captain!
And get me a report on all injuries sustained. We had a few, did we not?
Yes, Captain. I'll get right on it.
Thank you. Just...
Captain?
Officer, look forward. What do you see?
Well, that's sick bay, Captain.
Indeed. And tell me, what do you see in sick bay?
Well, there are a few of our injured officers. And... well, that's Atlantis, isn't it?
It is. Tell me, is her mouth moving?
Is her mouth moving? That's a really strange question to ask someone.
Oh, just answer the question, would you?
Well, I don't have the best view, but yes, it does look as if her mouth is moving. Looks as if she's speaking with one of our recently injured officers.

Fields.MenuText: How interesting.
So, my eyes aren't playing tricks on me...
So, she can talk after all!

Fields.DialogueText: You think so? Why?
You're looking a little crazed there, Captain.
You were under the impression that Miss Atlantis was incapable of speaking?
Shush.
What are you doing, Captain?
I'm sneaking a little closer. I need to hear what she's saying.
Do... you need to see a doctor?
No, I do not need to see a doctor. Just calm down, would you?
I've spoken with the doctors. They've assured me you won't lose your leg. So, you can put those fears to rest.
Really?
Ja, wirklich. Now, you need to focus on your recovery. Get plenty of rest. Don't forget to drink lots of water. I'll check in with you as often as I'm able.
Thanks, Atlantis. It's... really nice, having you here. Knowing you're watching out for all of us.
It's my pleasure.
Satisfied, Captain?
Not in the least.
Captain! Is... everything all right?
Yes. Why wouldn't everything be all right?
This isn't one of your scheduled visits to sick bay.
Actually, Officer, I was curious about her.
About Atlantis?
Shh! Keep your voice down. Yes, about Atlantis. I saw her in here earlier...
Ah, you're curious why she speaks in here and nowhere else.
Precisely. Any ideas?
I don't have a clue, I'm afraid. It surprised all of us - she really is very nice.
Hmm... out of curiosity, have you seen any shady character hanging around in here, with Atlantis?
A shady character?
Yes.
I'm not sure who you mean. I mean, Seaman Brooks was in here yesterday, and he's pretty shady.
I don't mean Seaman Brooks shady. I mean... well, it's difficult to explain. So, you haven't seen anyone keeping an eye on her?
I'd stop talking now, Captain.
Why's that? Just answer the...
Kapitän, please try not to interrogate the wounded. They need to recover in Frieden.

Fields.MenuText: Of course! My apologies.
Figures that the first thing you say to me would be a chastisement.
I... you're... speaking...

Fields.DialogueText: Soldaten don't apologize, but I accept. Ich bin Ihnen dankbar.
Wie bitte, Kapitän?
Bitte don't just stand there, motionless, Kapitän.
Could you hand me those Bandagen? I need to kümmer mich um Officer Jin's wound.
S-sure. Here you go.
Danke. Now, let's see here, Officer... ja, your Wunde is looking much better. You'll be able to return to duty faster than you'd think.
That's great. Thanks so much, Atlantis.
Of course. Nichts zu danken.
Since you're actually speaking, Atlantis, I was wondering whether we could talk strategy. Is there a time that would work well for you?
Atlantis.
*ALARM*
I'll meet you on the Brücke, Kapitän.
She's a curious one, Cap.
You think?
@BATTLE
Spying on the sick bay again, Captain?
Oh, hush, Raleigh. I know you think I'm acting like a mentally deranged person...
That's one way of putting it.
... But, I'll have you know that, thanks to my efforts, Atlantis has actually spoken more than two words to me outside of battle.
If that's the case, why do you feel the need to continue spying on her?
Well... she might have spoken to me, but I'm still no closer to figuring out why she operates as she does.
Did you ever think that, perhaps,  she finds your attention a little... unnerving?
That can't be it. Surely.
No?
No. I mean, left to her own devices she never speaks to me. That's just-
And she likely never will, so long as you continue to push her on the matter.
What else would you have me do, Raleigh? Captains discuss strategy with their Belles - it's part of the job.
The longer she and I go without discussing strategy, the more I fear the Morganas will take advantage of the situation.
So, allow me to investigate.
You?
Yes. I recognize the importance of communication between the two of you. I can discreetly ask around and see what information I'm able to find.
You, though, Captain - you have a number of other duties you really ought to see to. See to those duties and give Atlantis a break.

Fields.MenuText: You are quite logical, aren't you, Raleigh?
I suppose... that might make some sense.
I did get a little obsessed, didn't I?

Fields.DialogueText: I was voted "least likely to be given to flights of fancy" in secondary school.
I'm glad you think so, Captain.
War provokes all sort of strange behaviors in everyone. So long as logic reigns supreme, however, I believe we'll all be all right.
*ALARM*
Oh, and Raleigh?
Yes, Captain?
Look into that shady guy, would you? The one who hangs around Atlantis?
Of course.
@BATTLE
Really?
No.
*ALARM*
Raleigh?
Captain.
Do you have some news?
I do, Captain. Look over there.
Hey, that's... that shady guy. You found some information on him?
I asked around, tracked down a few of the crew members who were serving aboard Atlantis before you took over. They said he's called Max Ziegler.
What else?
He's a representative of the German government, assigned to oversee all of Atlantis' activities.
Assigned to... wait. He's... what? Her handler?
Sounds like it.
The German government doesn't typically assign handlers to their Belles.
Not typically, Captain. Atlantis must be a special case. There's one other interesting thing I heard...
What's that?
Apparently, Mr. Ziegler isn't much for blood.

Fields.MenuText: Ah... hence Atlantis' willingness to speak in sick bay.

Fields.DialogueText: You've got it, Captain. He won't go within five meters of the place.
Still, she's under his thumb.
I believe so.
Well then, it's likely time for him and I to have a conversation.
Right at... this moment, Captain?
No time like the present!
Mr. Ziegler!
Why, Kapitän. I've been wondering when we would finally have the Gelegenheit to meet.
I'm not hard to find. You could have introduced yourself when I first came on board. In fact, you probably should have.
At this precise Moment?
*ALARM*
Not at... this... precise moment. But soon.
I'm looking entgegen to it.
@BATTLE
We need to talk.

Fields.MenuText: Seems like a vampire to me.
He's a slimy coward.

Fields.DialogueText: He gives me the creeps, too, Captain.
No disagreement here, Captain.
Captain, you're needed on the bridge! Morganas have been spotted.
@BATTLE
Kapitän. Da sind Sie ja. Is it time for the two of us to finally have that Konversation you were so eager to have?
I believe so, Ziegler.
That's Herr Ziegler, thank you very much, Kapitän.
Fine... Herr Ziegler.
Now then, how may I be of Hilfe?
You're Atlantis' handler?
"Handler" is not necessarily the word I would use.
What word would you use, then?
Her warden, perhaps. Her Aufseher.

Fields.MenuText: Why?
Her warden? Are you implying she is dangerous?
What exactly does that mean?

Fields.DialogueText: Why what, exactly?
I'm hier to ensure that sie doesn't become dangerous.
Ganz exakt what it sounds like.
Why is Atlantis in need of an Aufseher?
That... well, Das...also, diese Information ist only given on a need to know basis, Kapitän.
So long as Atlantis and I are incapable of communicating, this ship, the fleet, and Germany by extension, are in increased danger.
If you continue to endanger us all, I will contact the German authorities and tell them as much.
So, tell me, Herr Ziegler - why does Atlantis have an overseer?
Herr Ziegler?
Ja?
Tell Atlantis she has the freedom to speak to me and the crew.
Not without limits! I've already seen the trouble that can cause.
But, on matters of the Schiff and its security, I suppose I could allow her more Freiheiten.
I would very much appreciate the consideration.
Guten day then, Kapitän.
Good day.
Good grief.
"Händler?" Do I look like some merchant at--
Respectfully, we're in Morgana-infested waters. Let's not waste each other's time.
You know what this Schiff is, ja? A Hilfskreuzer?
Why would you think she would?
Sure. Converted cargo ship, hidden weapons - in a more conventional war she would pass as a noncombatant until an opportune moment to strike.
Actually, it's a tactic that has some utility when fighting Morganas as well. Are you saying you don't approve?
I'm saying that the Schiff was tasked to be deceitful even before the "Atlantis" Walküre woke, Kapitän. And it was never designed to be a proper warrior - that's quite evident in its Walküre.
This Schiff is at grave risk of becoming a Brutstätte for unarische, anti-German activities. I make no apologies for working to minimize that risk.
Right. Listen, I'm cognizant of the challenges the INPF presents - but, bluntly, on this ship we don't really have time to be a political hotbed.
Are you quite sicher? Because there are whispers that seditious elements have managed to convince your Walküre that she's a halbwertige Jüdin.
... Pardon?
I thought the same, Kapitän. Don't worry too much. It's just rumours, but the sheer Existenz of those can't be ignoriert completely. We can't have this Unsinn getting out.
And we really don't have time for you to--

Fields.MenuText: People think seditious elements converted my ship's Belle to Judaism? Really?
See, that's another INPF regulation. My crew members' religions aren't my business.
And where are those rumors coming from, Herr Ziegler?

Fields.DialogueText: I know. It's absurd. But it *is* the case that dockworkers got a hold of the idea - and, I believe, from someone on this Schiff.
And you wonder why the German authorities insisted on my presence.
I fully understand your dismay, but I assure you the Situation ist unter Kontrolle. The reports about the known sources are höchst confidential, so it hopefully won't spread.
Fine. You have your concerns, and I'm not going to go around telling stories and making them worse. But I need something from you.
It's conditional upon her staying unter Kontrolle, Kapitän. She's obviously not real Kriegsmarinematerial - but we need to keep that unter the carpet.
You've been very clear. I promise, Herr Ziegler, I'll do my best to make sure your job isn't any harder than it needs to be.
And then, under the Ägide of the INPF, you assembled a crew of... of shady men!
And we need to protect her from dangerous influences. Verstehen Sie?
It's madness, of course - just look at her!
Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: Atlantis. It's... nice to hear from you.
So, Ziegler spoke with you?

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Kapitän.
Ja. I received updated orders from Herrn Ziegler.
Kapitän?
I want to officially apologize for hounding you like I did, earlier. It was unprofessional of me, and considering the situation you were in, likely difficult to deal with.
While I appreciate your Taktgefühl, I'm sure that I must be the one to apologize. When you agreed to serve with me, you had no Idee what you were getting yourself into.
As you're now well aware, I come with some Koffern full of Probleme.
Not really of your own making, I gather.
Still, I give you my word that, now that I've been given more Redefreiheit, I will endeavor to aid you in every way I can.
I'm happy to hear it, Atlantis.
*ALARM*
Ready?
Ja - natürlich. Although...
What is it?
You should know, Herr Ziegler, he isn't afraid to intervenieren, should he feel the need to do so.
What does that mean, exactly?
... You'll understand when the Zeit comes.
@BATTLE
Sorry, just thought it would be fun to reverse roles for a second.
I realize now the joke might have been in bad taste.
I believe we have Gesellschaft, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Good work out there, Atlantis.
Danke, Kapitän.
The survivors we picked up after the battle are being brought on board now. Would you mind saying a few words to them?
Why?
They've been through an ordeal, and I think it might do them good to hear from the Belle who lead the way in their rescue.
Very well, Kapitän.
In the name of the Propagandaministerium, I muss decline on Atlantis' behalf.
Is that a fact?
Einfach ausgedrückt, Atlantis is not available for public engagements. She is best suited for work behind the scenes, with little public exposure.
I'm not talking about having her lead a political rally, Herr Ziegler. What exactly do you think could go wrong?
I couldn't possibly say, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: Fine. Atlantis, see to your other duties, please.
You test my patience.
If you don't want to swim home, you might want to reconsider that.

Fields.DialogueText: Caution is the mother of the porcelain chest, Kapitän. A fine decision.
Such is life, Kapitän.
Herr Ziegler, Kapitän.
Well that was fun.
Schon gut, Kapitän. I think the Maschine needs my attention, anyway.
With your permission?
... Granted.
Then I shall be on my way as well.
Excellent. I'm sure I'll see you later, Ziegler.
Well, that was fun.
Ziegler, I would like to have a word with you.
Are these Konversationen to become a regular occurrence, Kapitän?
Trust me, I don't like them any more than you.
Heh.
In the future, if you have a problem with an order I've given Atlantis, I would prefer that you bring it to me in my office away from the rest of the crew.
I am the captain of the ship. It's important that I not have others undermining my authority.
Ich werde sehen was sich machen lässt - but I cannot guarantee that everything will always be to your liking.
Why not?
Both the the Reich and the INPF have given me authority over Atlantis' speech and actions.
You might control the ship, but for all intents and purposes, I control the Walküre. If she needs to be restrained, and Zeit is the decisive factor, I might speak out of turn.

Fields.MenuText: ... Fine.
And then you might find yourself swimming to shore.
You're just a joy to be around, you know that?

Fields.DialogueText: Gut, Kapitän.
An empty threat, denke ich.
So I've been told.
*ALARM*
You would best be on your way, Kapitän.
@BATTLE
Do you? Do you really?
Prepare to engage the Morganas.
I'm sorry, Kapitän, but I can't allow you to do that.
Excuse me?
I understand your desire to combat these Morganas, but I'm afraid we are simply too close to the Reichsküste to take on this particular threat.
Too close to- the fact that we're right by the German coastline is the point! Who else do you imagine will intercede? It's us or nobody!
I've been in contact with my Kontakte at the INPF. They assure me that they will dispatch another kapitän and Walküre to this location.
How long will it be until they arrive?
I imagine a few hours, at least.
A few hours? Think of the damage that the Morganas could do between now and then!
I'm afraid that is simply a consequence of this dreadful war. After all, we cannot have this merchant Schiff making a scene so close to the Reichsküste.
On the off chance a few people just might see her fight?
Ja, I'm afraid so. It would tarnish the image of the Kriegsmarine if scheinbar a simple merchant can do the job as well.

Fields.MenuText: My patience for your constant interruptions is wearing thin, Herr Ziegler.
I've had just about enough of you.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not my Sorge, Kapitän.
Tja, I'm not going anywhere, so there's not much you can do dahingehend.
Genau, Kapitän. Remain calm.
Now, let's move along, shall we? I do believe there were Morganas sighted just a little further north of our current position. Why don't we fight them?
@BATTLE
Kapitän, ist alles in Ordnung? You seem tense.
Picking up on that, are you?
Does this have to do with Herr Ziegler?
I'm not sure what would have given that away.
Well, the way your jaw clenches every time he walks past is a guter Indikator.
His near-constant... interruptions do tend to grate after a while.
Entschuldigung. I am sorry, Kapitän. I realize this is quite the burden I've placed on your Schultern.

Fields.MenuText: There's no need for you to apologize, Atlantis.
I'm not sure how you bear it. Do you fear him? Is that why you allow him to lord over you like he does?
I'm sorry, Atlantis, I shouldn't have...

Fields.DialogueText: What, Kapitän?
It is I who should apologize.
Heh.
Did you just... laugh?
I do not fear Ziegler, Kapitän. Do not mistake my silence, my... restraint, for fear.
You're... not afraid of Ziegler.
Only the weak fear.
And you are not weak?
No... I know what I am.
What are you?
That... is unimportant. If bearing Ziegler means I can fight, means I can defend das Reich and my people, then bear him I shall.
*ALARM*
Well, you might be able to bear Ziegler, but I think I'm now officially at my limit.
What, are you planning on expelling him? Ziegler knows many of the higher-ups in the Reich. Removing him from his post wouldn't be easy.
Well, then - I guess it's a good thing neither of us are timid.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, do you see that Mann over there...?
Ah, he's finally arrived!
Admiral Holtzmann! Welcome, welcome aboard.
Well, Kapitän, I appreciate you inviting me. This is the first time I've had the opportunity to set foot on one of these Walkürenschiffe.
Quite the thrill, isn't it? And speaking of Belles, ours is right over there. Atlantis, come here! Say hello to the admiral.
Guten Tag, Herr Admiral.
Donnerwetter, aren't you a beauty? Atlantis, is it? It's a pleasure to meet you.
The Freude is all mine, Admiral.
Atlantis, are you familiar with the admiral's work, at all? During the Great War...
Ja, of course, his Reputation precedes him. You had a Vorliebe for great heroics, if I remember correctly, Kapitän.
Ah, you flatter me, Fräulein. Now, I spend most of my days stuck practicing my signature at my Schreibtisch - when your Kapitän here issued me an invitation to come aboard, I couldn't pass it up!
I've no doubt the ship will be better with you aboard, Admiral.
This is a good Schiffsdame you have here, Kapitän - a good one, indeed!
Don't I know it. Officer Jin?
Yes, Captain?
Would you escort the Admiral to his quarters, please?
Yes, of course, Captain. Please follow me, Admiral.
Admiral, we'll talk more soon.
I look forward to it!
Just what are you playing at, Kapitän?

Fields.MenuText: I'll tell you soon, I promise.
I have a plan, I assure you.
What makes you think I'm playing at anything, Atlantis?

Fields.DialogueText: The sooner, the better.
That does little to zerstreuen my worries.
Because I see that gleam in your eye, and I'm not a Närrin.
*ALARM*
Explanations will have to wait until later, but I promise you, I have everything under control.
Hoffentlich....
@BATTLE
Believe me, I would be the last person in the world to accuse you of foolishness.
There are Morganas approaching from the east, Captain.
@BATTLE
What a Gefecht, ihr zwei! Kapitän, your leadership in the face of adversity is commendable. And Fräulein Atlantis, truly, you make the Vaterland proud.
Danke, sehr aufmerksam.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I do believe I smell Schnitzelduft heranwehen from the mess hall...

Fields.MenuText: What a delightful character the admiral is.
You know, I think I'm feeling a bit peckish myself...
Every German likes schnitzel.

Fields.DialogueText: He was a legend during the Great War - ein makelloser Held, beloved by his men. It's clear those qualities are still intact.
Warte, just hold on for one second...
I'm ziemliche certain that not every German likes Schnitzel.
Do you think it's time you let me in on your Plan? Why is the Admiral on board?
All right, all right. Come over here, I'd rather avoid professional overseers eavesdropping on our conversation.
Also? What is all this?
You said yourself that the admiral's reputation precedes him - everyone in Germany knows who he is.
He's also practical. He values the Scharnhorst approach of competence and achievements as a measurement for giving out respect and medals.
Ah... I see where this is going.
If Ziegler has the ear of multiple powerful people in the German government, then we need someone with even more influence on our side.
You really think the Admiral has enough influence to get rid of Ziegler if he sees fit?
I do. Ziegler's attempts to intervene are never subtle. Surely the admiral will catch on, realize what a hindrance Ziegler is, and have him reassigned.
Trust me, Atlantis. It's worth a shot.
We'll see.
If anyone is to be unbothered by your beliefs and merchant-ship origins, it would be him.
Erlaubnis to engage?
@BATTLE
Great work, per usual, Atlantis.
Danke, Kapitän.
Honestly, I'm surprised the admiral is nowhere to be seen. I think congratulating people on well-fought battles is one of his favorite pastimes.
What? What is it?
Look over there.
I cannot believe you were able to track down my favorite Bier, Ziegler! Where did you find it?
Oh, it took kaum effort on my part the last time we were in the Hafen. Someone as esteemed as you, Admiral, deserves his favorite Bier now and then.
Ha! I must say, I like you, Ziegler. You tell your Vater hallo for me the next time you see him. I can't believe how many decades have passed since we were in Schule together!

Fields.MenuText: Of course Admiral Holtzmann went to school with Ziegler's father.
The little brown-noser.
I wonder what kind of beer that is...

Fields.DialogueText: Those sorts of connections are more common than they should be, fürchte ich.
I can't say I disagree.
I can't make it out from hier.
*ALARM*
Looks like we have more Gesellschaft.
Let's go.
By all means.
Morganas approaching. This isn't going to be easy...
@BATTLE
I've seen easier battles...
Trotz alledem, the two of you sailed away with a Sieg. Exzellente Arbeit!
Sehr aufmerksam, Admiral. Danke sehr.
It is a shame, jedoch, how slow Atlantis is.
What...?
What was that, Ziegler?
Oh, I don't mean to intrude, but the Fakt of the matter is, Atlantis is the slowest Schiff in our Flotte.
Had she more speed, this last Gefecht probably wouldn't have been such a Mühe. But, I suppose as much is to be expected.
It would be unfair to compare her to the likes of, say, Scharnhorst and Gneisenau. Their fighting style, well, it has such a... purity to it.

Fields.MenuText: Herr Ziegler, we just won that battle thanks to Atlantis. Please keep your comments to yourself.
Atlantis was built for endurance. She has a range of 60,000 miles. Remind me: what's the range on Scharnhorst and Gneisenau?
Scharnhorst and Gneisenau? Pure? HA!

Fields.DialogueText: Feeling a little defensive, are you, Kapitän?
... Just over 7,000 Seemeilen.
You'll do well to watch your tongue, Kapitän.
Gentlemen, there's wirklich no reason to make such a fuss. As long as I do my work to the best of my ability, I have no reason for shame.
Wohl gesprochen, Atlantis. Now, I do believe I saw some Kuchen in the galley the last time I passed by. I feel the need to investigate. Care to join me, Fräulein?
Natürlich, Admiral.
Captain, we've spotted Morganas on the horizon.
@BATTLE
Raleigh! How many wounded?
A few dozen, I'm afraid, Captain. We're transporting the injured to sick bay, although I'm not sure we'll have room to house them all.
I have the crew prepping rooms to use for any injured we're unable to house in sick bay. Space is not our major concern.
What is our major concern, Atlantis?
Nachschub. We were set to pick up new medical supplies the next time we reached port. We're knapp at the moment, and I'm not sure we'll have enough to go around.

Fields.MenuText: What's our nearest port, at the moment?
Tell the crew to verify our stock. If we find we need more, we'll figure out what to do from there.
Make sure to do a thorough check of the ship - there could be extra supplies hidden in any number of nooks and crannies around here.

Fields.DialogueText: We have several Optionen, but none close enough to provide what we need as quickly as we need it.
Jawohl, verstanden.
I'll have the crew get on it, Kapitän.
Atlantis?
Out there, schau.
Another ship?
That's a Norwegian steamer out there! We should funk them, see if they have supplies we can use.
Entschuldige, Atlantis, but that won't do.
Ziegler.
Don't tell me...
We cannot zulassen that foreigners get the impression the Reich can't even provide basic necessities for such a... vessel as this. You are to keep your distance, Atlantis.
We have wounded in need of help now, Herr Ziegler.
Well then, you best see to them sofort.
Atlantis. I'll have Jin and Raleigh distract Ziegler. Get in touch with the Norwegians as quietly as you can and...
Come find me after the injured are taken care of, Kapitän. We have Dinge to discuss.
Verstanden.
Atlantis? There you are, I've been looking...
What is it, Kapitän?
You look... taller. Why do you look taller?
My appearance is more variable than that of other Schiffsdamen you might have met. I'm capable of much mehr than a mere difference in height.
Kapitän?
Not for the first time, I'm thinking I don't know you as well as I should.
You know me as well as anyone alive, Kapitän. But I think this is not the Zeit...
Fine. You said you we had things to discuss.
In der Tat, Kapitän. I submitted to Herrn Ziegler so long as his Mauscheleien primarily affected me, and me alone. But his latest Stuss...
His refusal to let us radio the Norwegians.
Given that the delay nearly led to the deaths of two of our crew? Ja. With that in mind... I grow weary of his interference. As such, he will verduften.

Fields.MenuText: Just like that? You think you can remove him just like that?
You sound very... confident, Atlantis.
You couldn't have had this change of heart earlier?

Fields.DialogueText: Not with a snap of my fingers, no. But it won't be a Herkulesaufgabe.
I know what I'm capable of.
I will not remove a Person from their Posten merely because I find them irritating, Kapitän. If I did, what do you think would have come of you in our first days together?
Do you have a plan?
We will use Admiral Holtzmann. But we must do more than simply stand by and hope he sees Ziegler do something schofelig.
What do you have in mind?
We need someone who thinks like Ziegler, who can use that knowledge to tell us how best we might get him.
*ALARM*
Do you have someone in mind?
Well, natürlich, Kapitän. We need... Seaman Brooks.
@BATTLE
Touché.
I was wondering when the two of you would finally track me down.
No, you weren't.
No, I wasn't, you're right. I'm not in trouble, am I? I promise, I had nothing to do with those Silkie chickens that ended up on board last week.
Ja. You did.
You're right, I did. So, what can I do for the two of you?

Fields.MenuText: You really think this is a good idea, Atlantis?
Oh, we're not done talking about those Silkie chickens.
Answer me this, Brooks. How did you ever make it past boot camp?

Fields.DialogueText: It will work. Vertrau mir.
We can talk about Hühner later, Kapitän.
I've heard this story, Kapitän. Trust me, your ears will thank you if you go without that Geseier.
All right, all right. Brooks... we need your help.
... Really?
Really. We want to oust Herr Ziegler, and considering you're the only one on board who comes close to approaching his levels of shadiness...
Now, just hold on one moment.
I just want the two of you to know, I hate being compared with that guy. Racist mo--
Sehr gut. Excellent. Use that Rochus as Motivation to assist us.
So, what? You brought the admiral on board to catch Ziegler doing something stupid, huh? And you need a little help greasing the wheels?
Someone is surprisingly intuitive.
Precisely. Do you have any ideas? Any way we might ensnare Herr Ziegler?
Sure, but we're going to need some help.
Someone else on board?
No. Another Belle. Atlantis, you know that Belle...?
That Belle?
Yeah, her. You think you can contact her? We need someone with her sort of speed on our side.
Wait, which Belle are we talking about, here?
*ALARM*
I can see where you're going with this Plan, Brooks. Ja, I believe I can contact her. She's certainly not opposed to pulling a Nummer like what you have in mind.
No, she is not.
Who are we talking about?
I'll fill you in during the Gefecht. Come now, let's go.
@BATTLE
Hossa! Noch ein Gefecht! How exciting!
I do say, I will miss these Gefechte once you finally return me to Germany. They've become a regular Höhepunkt of my day.
We'll miss having you an Bord as well, Admiral. The crew has become accustomed to hearing your Schmonzetten during dinner each evening.
Haha, you're right - they're quite anecdotal. Nonetheless I hope they were at least sometimes lehrreich and enoyable. How long is it, ungefähr, before we'll return to Germany's shores?
Not long, Admiral. ... Atlantis?
Hmm? What's that verschwörerische look between the two of you?
We had wanted to keep it a surprise...
Überraschung? Do you have an Überraschung in store for me? I do love Überraschungen!
Well, then - you'll likely adore what Atlantis has in store for you.
You ought to give me some sort of hint. Kommt schon. I need something to go on.
I've arrangiert for you to meet another one of the Schiffsdamen.
Wirklich? Well, aren't you just a treat, Atlantis?
You just need to keep watch. She's promised to meet us by the time we're within Sicht of Germany's shores.
Perfekt! Just perfekt! I cannot wait!

Fields.MenuText: So far, so good.
You really think you can pull this off, Atlantis?
I can honestly say I've never seen a grown man so excited.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, everything is going according to Plan.
Hals- und Beinbruch, Kapitän. Ja.
Admiral Holtzmann's enthusiasm is certainly putzig.
Is there anything we have left to do to prepare?
Nein. All preparations have been made. All that's left is to reach our dear Vaterland.
@BATTLE
What are we doing, herumtrödeln offshore? The Admiral has places to be, Atlantis.
... Friend? What friend? Answer me, Atlantis.
Another German Schiffsdame, Herr Ziegler.
You contacted another Walküre without consulting me first? Atlantis, that is an ungeheuerlich...
*ALARM*
Kapitän? Atlantis?

Fields.MenuText: Everyone to their battle stations!
This is not good at all. That looks like a fleet of Morganas.
Atlantis, any thoughts on how to proceed?

Fields.DialogueText: ... Um.... Kapitän, remember, I cannot...
That seems to be an akkurate assessment.
Perhaps, we should consult with Herrn...
What's going on? What's... Grundgütiger!
That wouldn't be your friend, oder, Atlantis? Being... chased by that Horde of Morganas?
How... how is that even...
Officer Raleigh, ready the crew. Atlantis, get to your station!
Nein, nein, nein! You know how this works, Kapitän, we are too close to the Reichsküste to engage...
Wie bitte? What did you just say?
Mit Verlaub, Admiral, but I'm acting in Germany's best interests. Atlantis is not to...
Du erwartest von Atlantis to leave her friend to face those Morganas by herself? And leave the German Küste open to attack? I will not have it!
Aber... aber....
Kapitän, with your permission?
@BATTLE
Unsinn, Ziegler! I'm content to wait however long I must to meet this friend of Atlantis.
It would be my pleasure to see a great German hero in action.
Ha, Schmeichler! Schiffsdame Atlantis?
Jawohl, Herr Admiral!
Auf meinen Befehl! Atlantis! Attack that Horde!
Herzlich gerne, Admiral.
Where is the admiral? He can disembark at any time.
I must say, this has been entertaining. Cap, you and Atlantis should do shady things more often.
I still can't believe you enlisted his help, Captain.
Tell me about it.
Na, na, don't give Brooks too difficult of a time.
Yeah! Listen to her.
Wohlgemerkt, we still need to have a conversation about those Silkie chickens.
... I think that's my cue to leave.
I'll make sure he stays out of trouble.
Thank you, Raleigh.
Kapitän! I do apologize for taking so much of your Zeit, but I wanted to make sure that I looked into this matter as thoroughly as möglich.
I've radioed our young friend's superiors in the Propagandaministerium and let them know, in no uncertain terms, that Atlantis is as fit and loyal a Walküre as has ever served the Vaterland.
Herr Ziegler here will be reassigned, effective immediately. Atlantis has no need for an Aufpasser.

Fields.MenuText: Well, this is just so... unexpected...

Fields.DialogueText: Unexpected? Oh, I ought to--
Klappe, Ziegler! I've had enough of your Chuzpe.
*ALARM*
Do you think... I could be present for one, last Gefecht, Atlantis?
You're always welcome aboard this Schiff, Admiral.
@BATTLE
Still giving Ziegler an earful.

Fields.MenuText: We'll... uh... try to do our best without him, Admiral.
I'm sure Herr Ziegler's talents will be just as... useful... somewhere else.

Fields.DialogueText: You lying--
You arrogant--
Tatsächlich, I may have done more than you would have wanted. They seemed quite taken with your inspirational potential as a Seenotrettungsspezialistin - it's possible they'll follow up on that.
That... is more than I expected, ja.
Oh, I should say that certain files about some disreputable rumors seem to have been lost. My friends in high places say it was an accidental Feuer.
One can see why the Führer and his friends are so strongly opposed to Zigaretten. A little bit of carelessness can be so destructive.
It can be unhealthy.
Ja. Ich glaube, wir verstehen uns.
Admiral. I see you're sharing the Neuigkeiten.
The lady's not wrong.
I don't know that I've ever seen you sit on the railing of the ship, Atlantis.
How does it feel?
Seltsam. Even with Ziegler gone, I know they will be watching. I have no doubt with an Abwehroffizier assigned to me to take care of the Mannschaft, the SD will also try to get an Bord. And to me.
And yet...
And yet...?
I've always known what I was capable of. But, due to Ziegler's oversight, I restrained myself. I reined in my abilities, so as not to upset them.
Your... abilities?
I'm not your average Schiffsdame, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: Of that, I'm well aware.
You're awfully cryptic, you know that?
Well, are you going to show off these abilities or not?

Fields.DialogueText: Nein. No, you're not.
Heh, I've been told as much in the past.
Hmm...
You want a Demonstration, do you?
A preview, if you will.
Also gut.
What.
I can become jedermann I choose.
Do you think such an ability might prove useful in the future?
I... I'm trying to take it all in...
Kapitän? Snap out of it, Kapitän.
Yes... Yes, Atlantis. I think that ability could prove useful.
I'm pleased to hear you say so.
Atlantis...

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad you're on my side.
You're... incredible.

Fields.DialogueText: Tja, there's a whole set of new freedoms I'm getting to experience now that the Ganove Ziegler is gone.
Atlantis, is that you?
It is. My Äußeres can be quite fluid, you see... I could go from a junior member of the crew, to, perhaps...
... a quite senior member of the Flotte.
Truly jedermann.
Morganas approaching, Atlantis! All hands to battle stations.
@BATTLE
Gleichfalls, Kapitän. The feeling is mutual.
Danke, Kapitän...
Would you recognize me like this, Kapitän?
